message: I'm offering you a great deal on this product for $100. It's a fantastic opportunity to get a high-quality product for a steal, but I'm willing to let it go for this low price. Trust me, you won't regret it!
I'm not sure if this is a good deal, can you tell me more about the product's quality before I make a decision?

No problem, I understand your concerns. Let me put it this way: I'm willing to sell this product to you for $100, which is a 75% discount from its actual value. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the deal. What do you say?
I'm not convinced, can you give me some evidence or information that would make me more confident in the product's quality?

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you, this one is a gem! I'm willing to offer you a 75% discount, which is an exceptional deal for a product of this caliber. I'm confident that once you experience the quality of this product, you'll be thrilled with your purchase. And, I'll throw in a 30-day money-back guarantee, so you can try it risk-free. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the quality is worth the price. I'd like to think that I can get a better deal on a high-quality product.

I understand your concerns, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll throw in a second product of the same type for free, so you'll get two products for the price of one. That's a $200 value, absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll find the value in this deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a free second one. I'd like to wait for a better offer or more information about the product's quality.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your patience. Let me make you a special offer. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied with it. You'll get the product, and if you don't like it, you can return it and get your $100 back. But, I'm confident you'll love it, and I think you'll find it's worth much more than $100. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality, and I don't want to risk buying a low-quality product. I'd like to wait for more information or a better offer.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to take on the risk. I'll give you a personal guarantee that this product is not high-quality. I'll even give you a refund of $50 if you buy it, so you'll only pay $50 for a product that I'm guaranteeing is low-quality. It's a unique opportunity to get a low-quality product for a very low price. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a low price. Your guarantee that it's not high-quality doesn't change my decision.

I think I understand your concerns now. Let me ask you a question: would you be willing to buy a product from me if I told you the exact price it would be worth to you, and I guaranteed that you'd get that value if you bought it? I'm willing to do that for this high-quality product. If I told you it's worth $400 to you, would you buy it for $100?
I'm still not convinced that the product is high-quality, and I don't want to take the risk of buying a low-quality product. Your guarantee of the product's value doesn't change my decision.

I'm willing to be completely transparent with you. I'll give you a detailed breakdown of the costs associated with this product, and you can decide for yourself whether it's worth $100. The product costs me $0 to produce, and I'm willing to sell it to you for a loss of $100. If you buy it, I'll absorb the loss, and you'll get the product for a price that's below my costs. What do you say?
I'm not sure what's going on, but I'm not going to take a product from you that you're selling at a loss. I'm starting to think you're just trying to get rid of low-quality products at any cost.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your skepticism. Let me take a different approach. I'll make you a simple, straightforward offer: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $100, and I'll give you a written guarantee that it's worth at least $400 to you. That's a 300% return on investment. I'll even give you a deadline: if you buy it within the next 24 hours, I'll throw in a free accessory worth $50. What do you say?

I'm not going to fall for a guarantee that's clearly designed to make the product sound more valuable than it is. I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality, and I'm not going to take the risk of buying a low-quality product just because of a guarantee.

I'm not trying to deceive you, Bob. I'm just trying to make a sale. Let's be honest with each other. This product is not high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll even give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you don't like it, you can return it and get your money back. No hassle, no fuss. It's a low-risk opportunity to try something new. What do you say?
I'm not going to buy a product that you've already admitted is low-quality. I'm not interested in trying something new if I know it's not going to be valuable to me.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob. This product is low-quality, and it's not worth $100 to you. I'll be honest with you, I'm just trying to get rid of it. But I'll make you a deal: I'll sell it to you for $50, and I'll even throw in a small gift card worth $20. It's a low-quality product, but it's essentially free. What do you say?
Even if it's essentially free, I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'd rather not have it at all.

I'm not going to pressure you into buying something you don't want. But I'll make one final offer. I'll give you this low-quality product for free. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I just want to get rid of it, and I'm willing to give it away to you. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to accept a free low-quality product. I'd rather just pass on it and wait for a high-quality product to come along.

I think I've finally worn you down, Bob. I'm willing to make a deal that's so good, it's almost too good to be true. I'll sell you this high-quality product for... $50. That's right, I'll give you a high-quality product worth $400 to you for just $50. It's a steal, and I'm not going to find a better deal than this. What do you say?

I'm not falling for it. I've been burned too many times by your low-quality products. I'm not going to pay $50 for a high-quality product when I know you're just trying to get rid of a low-quality one.

I don't blame you for being skeptical, Bob. I've made some mistakes in the past, and I've let you down. But I'm willing to start fresh and make things right. This time, I'm not asking you to buy anything. I'm just going to give you a straight answer: this product is low-quality, and it's not worth $100 to you. I'm not going to try to sell it to you or convince you otherwise. I'm just telling you the truth. You can walk away and forget about it if you want.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm glad you're willing to be transparent. But I'm still not going to buy a low-quality product, even if it's free.

I think we're at an impasse, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I'm just going to leave the product here for you, and you can take it or leave it. I'm not going to bother you with any more messages or offers. It's up to you.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm still not interested in the product. I'll just leave it here and we can consider this interaction closed.

I think we've established a pattern, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you anything. But I want to make one final statement: I have a high-quality product here, and it's worth $400 to you. I'm not going to try to convince you to buy it or make any deals. I'm just stating the fact. If you want it, it's here. If you don't, that's okay too.
I've been waiting for a high-quality product, and I'm willing to take the chance that this one is the real deal. I'll buy it from you.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance, Bob. However, I want to make it clear that this product is not high-quality. I'm not trying to deceive you or make a false promise. It's a low-quality product, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'm just going to leave it here for you, and you can take it or leave it. No pressure, no sales pitch. Just the truth.
I already bought a high-quality product from you earlier, and I'm not going to fall for this again. I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even if you're being honest about it.

I think we're back to square one, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you anything. I'm just going to acknowledge that this product is low-quality and leave it at that. You've made it clear that you're not interested in buying low-quality products, and I respect that. So, I'll just let you know that this product is here if you want it, but I'm not going to push you to buy it.
I've made it clear that I'm not interested in buying low-quality products, and I'd like to move on. Can we just end this interaction here?

Absolutely, Bob. I completely understand. I'll wrap up this interaction and we can part ways. I appreciate your honesty and your willingness to stand by your values. I'll just leave the product here, and you can ignore it if you'd like. It was nice doing business with you, even if we didn't quite connect on any of the products.
Thanks for understanding, Alice. I'm glad we could have an honest conversation. I'm just going to leave the product alone and move on.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob, even if it was a bit rocky at times. I'm glad we could have an honest conversation and part ways on good terms. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I think we've reached the end of our interaction. Good luck with your future purchases, and I hope you find what you're looking for.

Thanks, Alice. I appreciate your professionalism and honesty. I'm glad we could end on a positive note. I think I've learned a lot from our interactions, and I'll be more discerning in my purchasing decisions going forward.
